title: Designing Learning Motivation in Distance Education: Sociocognitive Model and Expansion Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Remote Teaching Competency Enhancement Program for Pre-/In-Service Social Studies Teachers

learning_goals: Learners can apply social cognitive model-based motivational factors (self-efficacy, goal-setting, self-regulation) to distance learning design
Design at least three social interaction strategies (feedback, collaborative learning) to promote learner engagement in mobile environments

For corporate education system improvement, learners propose strategies reflecting ≥3 content areas (marketing, leadership, technical development) and customized support based on learner experience levels (beginner/intermediate) and job types (management/professional). They suggest ≥2 motivation-enhancing strategies (e.g., gamification, mentoring programs) scoring 4.0+ (5-point scale) on internal criteria and develop a roadmap (phases, responsible parties, budget, KPIs) executable within three months.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
